Overview: Oho Enthan Baby (2025) is a Tamil coming-of-age romantic dramedy directed by Krishnakumar Ramakumar in his debut. The film stars Rudra as Ashwin, an aspiring filmmaker who navigates love and heartbreak across different stages of his life. His relationship with Meera, played by Mithila Palkar, becomes both his muse and a turning point in his emotional journey. The story is told through a blend of humor, nostalgia, and heartfelt moments, as Ashwin reflects on his past lovesfrom school crushes to mature romance. The film also features Vishnu Vishal in a unique cameo as himself, adding a playful, meta dimension. With its grounded tone and emotional honesty, Oho Enthan Baby explores the bittersweet nature of love, loss, and creative inspiration.

Overview: Sivandha Mann, also spelt as Sivantha Mann, is a 1969 Indian Tamil language film written, produced and directed by C.V. Sridhar that stars Sivaji Ganesan, Kanchana and M. N. Nambiar in the lead roles, while other actors like R. Muthuraman, Nagesh and S. V. Ranga Rao play supporting roles. It is notably the first Tamil film to be shot extensively in locations outside India, and later Tamil and Telugu films "fell to the French charm" after this. The film was a major success. A Hindi remake titled Dharti starred Rajendra Kumar and Waheeda Rehman in the lead, along with Sivaji Ganesan in a cameo role.
combined_features: Sivandha Mann, also spelt as Sivantha Mann, is a 1969 Indian Tamil language film written, produced and directed by C.V. Sridhar that stars Sivaji Ganesan, Kanchana and M. N.
